pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

LGTM (sorry forgot about it)
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11292985425/job/31410123707)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11292985425/job/31410124480)
I think this deserves definitions instead of exists statements. (`A` is the scheme theoretic image, and we might want to glue them later)
I finally got to this and turned the exists statements into definitions.
I think the ideal could get its definition as well as it appears multiple times below.
This does not seem to apply here, since here we are talking about the underlying ring map being surjective, not the map of topological spaces.

You should use `(Scheme.Î“SpecIso B).inv` instead of `toSpecÎ“` (they are defeq) because the latter is in terms of locally ringed spaces. Maybe I should add a warning. And the proof becomes
```
example {X : Scheme.{u}} {B : CommRingCat} (Ï† : B âŸ¶ Î“(X, âŠ¤)) :
    (Scheme.Î“SpecIso B).inv â‰« ((Î“Spec.adjunction.homEquiv X (op B)) Ï†.op).app âŠ¤ = Ï† := by
  simp [Adjunction.homEquiv_apply]
  rw [Î“Spec.adjunction_unit_app_app_top]
  simp
```
Either you should squeeze it or maybe investigate why the simp lemma does not trigger.
Anyways in general you shouldn't unfold `Î“Spec.adjunction` at all and use the simp lemmas provided. It should be always possible as the morphism are uniquely identified by the adjunction properties.
Ah I remember, you have told me before. We should just make all of the forbidden ones private.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): factorization of morphisms with affine target
